intro: Sonnea jonesii, commonly known as Jones' sonnea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Sonnea jonesii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
